text:
2018 Rate Hikes: West Virginia: 17.8% w/out CSR sabotage, 27.8% with
Wed, 08/02/2017 - 10:22pm
Another fairly straightfoward state: Three carriers, two of which (CareFirst and Health Plan of Upper Ohio Valley) appear to be assuming CSR paymentswillbe paid; the third, Highmark BCBS (which holds the vast bulk of the individual market) openly states that they assumethey won'tbe made and that the mandate won't be enforced to boot. I'm once again assuming roughly 2/3 of Kaiser Family Foundation's "Silver CSR hike", which in this case would be about 10%, giving the following: 17.8% if CSR payments are made, 27.8% if they are:
